FuncDef:
The bandwidth command configures a packet sending bandwidth on a DCN interface.
By default, the packet sending bandwidth of DCN POS interface is 1024 and DCN serial interface is 192 kbit/s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the bandwidth of a POS interface.
The value is an integer and can be 64, 128, 192, 256, 512, 1024, or 2048, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of a serial interface.
The value is an integer and can be 64, 128, 192, 256, 512, 1024, or 2048, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of an Ethernet interface.
The value is an integer and can be 64, 128, 192, 256, 512, 1024, or 2048, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To improve system performance, you can decrease the packet sending bandwidth of a DCN interface to reduce CPU usage when the device is heavily loaded but increase the packet sending bandwidth to raise CPU usage when the device is lightly loaded.
The bandwidth command helps modify the packet sending bandwidth of a DCN interface based on CPU usage.
The bandwidth command is supported only in transport mode.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
